title.rendered: How to Find Solar Panel Installer Job in New York City

content.rendered:
A wide range of employment opportunities are available for solar installers in New York. Various entities such as solar installation companies, construction firms, energy consultancies, and government agencies are actively searching for skilled professionals to meet the increasing demand for solar energy solutions. Moreover, the state offers incentives and subsidies for solar installation, strengthening the job market for solar system installers and creating a favourable career growth and advancement environment. Embarking on a career as a solar installer can provide access to numerous prospects within the renewable energy sector. This article offers advice on establishing a career as a solar installer in New York, covering topics such as obtaining a solar installation position, the essential skills required, and the duties of this profession.

Who is a Solar Panel Installer?

A solar panel installer is responsible for assembling, installing, and servicing PV solar panel systems on rooftops or other structures. They are essential in the expanding clean energy industry, guaranteeing the efficient conversion of sunlight into energy. Technicians perform site evaluations, develop blueprints, set up mechanical frameworks, and link the panels to the electrical grid. Additionally, they perform regular maintenance to uphold the optimal functionality of these systems.

Other Job Category

  • How to Work as a Solar System Designer in Canada
  • How to Work as a Solar System Designer in New York
  • How to Work as a Solar System Designer in Australia

Job Duties of a Solar Panel Installer in New York  

As a solar panel installer, your primary duty will involve installing and maintaining solar panels on various structures and open spaces in New York. Your main objective will be to ensure the effective conversion of solar power into renewable energy. Most of your tasks as a solar panel installer will occur outdoors and at elevated heights.

The duties of a solar panel installer encompass:

  • Evaluating sites to verify their suitability for solar panels 
  • Taking measurements for installation purposes 
  • Modifying building surfaces as needed to ensure proper fit and support for panels 
  • Setting up and servicing solar panels on residential properties, commercial buildings, or open areas 
  • Linking solar panels to an electrical setup 
  • Grounding electrical devices and inspecting wiring 
  • Following rigorous health and safety protocols 
  • Conducting routine maintenance inspections and repairing solar panels 
  • Utilizing a range of technical tools and equipment

Qualification of a solar panel installation job in New York 

  • Possession of a high school diploma or its equivalent
  • Successful completion of a solar panel installation training program or applicable certifications (such as NABCEP certification)
  • Previous experience in electrical work, construction, or a related industry is advantageous.
  • Proficiency in technical aspects of electrical systems, solar panel technology, and utilization of power tools
  • Good physical condition to work at elevated heights, handle heavy machinery, and operate in diverse weather conditions.
  • Practical communication skills, ability to collaborate within a team, and commitment to prioritizing safety.

How Do You Become a Solar Panel Installer in New York City? 

To become a solar panel installer in New York City, obtaining a combination of education, training, and certification is typically necessary.

  • Education and training:

To pursue a career as a solar panel installer in New York, it is essential to acquire a high school diploma. Certain employers may have a preference for candidates who have pursued additional education, such as an associate degree or vocational training in electrical or renewable energy fields.

  • Apprenticeship:

After your education, you will likely start your professional career as an apprentice or an entry-level installer, working alongside experienced professionals. The practical training you receive during this time will be crucial in learning the industry’s best practices, improving your skills, and gaining valuable knowledge about the practical difficulties and challenges of installing solar panels.

  • Certification

Acquiring a certification specific to your state and local region is imperative to pursue a solar panel installer career. While certification is not obligatory, it can significantly bolster your professional reputation and open up promising opportunities. The NORTH AMERICAN BOARD OF CERTIFIED ENERGY PRACTITIONER (NABCED) provides the most esteemed certification for solar installers, necessitating successful completion of an examination and fulfilment of specific educational and experiential prerequisites.

  • Licensing:

Acquiring an electrical and general contractor license is essential to operate as a self-employed solar installer. Some regions may mandate minimum practical experience before granting a permit. Numerous locations also necessitate candidates to finish designated educational and training courses successfully.

  • Keep yourself informed.:

Stay updated on the most recent advancements and innovations in the solar industry by actively pursuing ongoing education and professional development prospects.

  • Apply for Jobs: 

You may seek employment with solar installation companies upon acquiring the essential education, experience, certifications, and licensing. Engaging in networking activities within the industry in New York can also prove beneficial in uncovering job prospects.

How Much Does a Solar Panel Installer Earn in New York?

The annual salary for a solar installer in New York is $45,765, with an hourly rate of $22. Those starting at entry-level positions can expect to earn $40,950 per year, while the most experienced workers can make up to $58,500 annually.

How Do You Get a Job in a Solar Panel Installation Company?

Since there’s a demand from people switching to renewable energy and for solar panel installers’ expertise, here are the ways to get a job as a solar panel installer in New York. 

  • Engage in extensive research to deeply understand the industry:

Gain knowledge about the solar energy sector in New York by familiarizing yourself with the latest market trends, prominent industry participants, regulations, and incentives associated with implementing solar energy systems.

  • Education and Training:

Although a high school diploma may meet the requirements for certain entry-level jobs, acquiring appropriate education and training can give you a competitive advantage. Consider joining vocational programs, taking community college classes, or attending trade schools offering solar panel installation instruction. Certain institutions also provide specialized certification programs for solar installation.

  • Acquire Certifications: 

Acquire the necessary certifications to demonstrate your expertise as a solar panel installer. Certifications such as the North American Board of Certified Energy Practitioners (NABCEP) certification carry great importance in the solar industry in the United States.

  • Networking:

Participating in industry events, workshops, and New York conferences specifically focusing on solar energy is strongly advised. By interacting with seasoned professionals already established in this field, individuals can gain valuable insights into job opportunities and develop significant connections.

  • Revise Your Resume and Cover Letter:

Ensure that your resume and cover letter are customized to showcase your pertinent skills, education, and expertise in solar panel installation. Place special emphasis on any certifications or training you have acquired.

  • Search for Job Openings: 

You can explore various avenues to find job openings in solar panel installation in New York. Use online job boards, company websites, and industry-specific job portals to widen your search. Additionally, consider contacting solar installation companies in the area directly to inquire about potential job opportunities.

  • Prepare for Interviews: 

It is essential to familiarize yourself with typical interview questions and ensure you are ready to elaborate on your background, abilities, and credentials in the field of solar panel installation. Emphasize your enthusiasm for sustainable energy and your dedication to the sector.

What Does a Solar Panel Installation Involve?

We have emphasized the importance of becoming a certified solar panel installer in the renewable energy industry, but what exactly does this role involve? Here is an overview of your tasks as a professional solar panel installer. The process of installing solar panels generally includes the following steps:

  • Site Evaluation:

A solar panel installation expert will come to your property to evaluate its viability for installing solar panels. They will assess factors like the orientation of your roof, the amount of shade it receives, and the structural integrity of your property.

  • Proposal for Design:

Upon thoroughly evaluating the site, the Installer will create a customized solar PV system that caters to your individual requirements. Subsequently, you will be presented with a proposal that details the system’s specifications, associated expenses, and potential savings.

  • Permission:

Before the installation, permits must be obtained from the local government or relevant authorities. This procedure includes submitting required documentation and securing approvals to guarantee adherence to building codes and regulations.

  • Equipment Acquisition:

Once the design is completed and the necessary permits are obtained, the solar panels, inverters, mounting hardware, and other required equipment will be purchased.

  • Installation:

The installation process usually starts by preparing the roof (or ground) for installing solar panels. This could include strengthening the structure if needed. Subsequently, racks or frames for mounting are put in place, and then the solar panels are positioned on these mounts. Wiring is then set up to link the panels to the electrical system, and inverters are set up to transform the DC electricity produced by the panels into usable AC electricity.

  • Connection of electricity: 

After installing the panels and inverters, the electrical components will be linked to the electrical system in your residence. This process could require the installation of a new meter or the adjusting your current electrical panel.

  • Inspection and Interconnection:

Upon completion of the installation and connection of the system, the local utility or relevant authority must inspect to verify adherence to safety and performance regulations. Following a successful inspection, the system can then be integrated with the grid, enabling solar power generation to commence.

  • Maintenance:

It is crucial to regularly monitor your solar system’s performance once it is up and running to verify that it is producing the anticipated amount of electricity. Additionally, routine maintenance, including cleaning the panels and inspecting for any signs of damage, is essential to maintain the system’s efficiency.

Companies recruiting Solar Panel Installers in New York

Companies in the solar energy sector that operate in New York and may potentially be recruiting solar panel installers:

  1. SunPower
  2. Sunrun
  3. Tesla Energy
  4. Vivint Solar
  5. Trinity Solar
  6. Sunnova
  7. SunPower by EmPower Solar
  8. SolarCity (a subsidiary of Tesla)
  9. New York State Solar Farm
  10. Hudson Solar
  11. Momentum Solar
  12. OnForce Solar
  13. Green Street Solar Power
  14. SolarEdge Technologies
  15. Brooklyn SolarWorks
  16. NY State Solar
  17. Direct Energy Solar (formerly Astrum Solar)
  18. Grid City Energy
  19. YellowLite
  20. Solar Liberty

How to Apply

If you are passionate about renewable energy and looking to join a dynamic team in the growing solar industry, we encourage you to apply using the link below:
